newsitem.title: ITALY: Safilo turnover up 28 pct in 1st 9 months.
newsitem.headline: Safilo turnover up 28 pct in 1st 9 months.

text.p: Italian spectacle frame maker Safilo said group turnover in the first nine months of 1996 rose 28 percent to 405.5 billion lire from the year-ago period.
Third quarter turnover totalled 134 billion lire, up 34 percent on the same 1995 period, Safilo said in a statement.
Group financial charges after its acquisitions of U.S. sports sunglasses group Smith Sports Optics Inc in March and Austrian Carrera-Optyl in July were limited to 2.1 percent of turnover, it said.
Operating profitability in the first nine months had equalled 9.6 percent of revenue.
Safilo said in September it aimed for turnover of one trillion lire by 1998.
